summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between a federal prosecutor and the Metropolitan Correctional Center, requesting expedited production of Jeffrey Epstein's jail emails and phone records, while excluding communications with his attorneys. It shows the government's active investigation into Epstein's communications shortly after his arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose jail emails and phone call recordings are being subpoenaed by federal prosecutors from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the email and phone record production requested by prosecutors.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the email and phone record production requested by prosecutors.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the email and phone record production requested by prosecutors.

connections.description: Epstein is represented by attorney Marc Fernich, as evidenced by prosecutors seeking to exclude their communications from jail monitoring.
Epstein is represented by attorney Martin Weinberg, as evidenced by prosecutors seeking to exclude their communications from jail monitoring.
Epstein is represented by attorney Reid Weingarten, as evidenced by prosecutors seeking to exclude their communications from jail monitoring.

events.title: Prosecutors Request Epstein's Jail Communications
events.description: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York subpoena and request Jeffrey Epstein's email correspondence and phone call recordings from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, while excluding attorney-client communications.

events.title: Expedited Subpoena Return Date
events.description: Prosecutors set a return date for the subpoena of Epstein's jail communications for July 12, 2019, indicating urgency in their investigation.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's jail communications in July 2019, shortly after his arrest.
Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at the time.
Prosecutors specifically sought to exclude attorney-client communications with Marc Fernich, Martin Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten from their subpoena.
The document shows urgency with a same-day return date request for the subpoena and a high importance designation on the email.
